title: Domain
description: Schema for domain JSON files that define domains in the model. A domain represents a major functional area. Domain files are located in a directory named after the domain (e.g., 'order_management/domain.json' or 'order_management/this.domain'). The directory name becomes the domain's key, which is used as a prefix for classes and other elements within the domain. If validation fails, verify 'name' is present and non-empty.

name.description: The display name of the domain (e.g., 'Order Management', 'User Authentication'). This is the human-readable name shown in diagrams. Must be non-empty. If validation fails: ensure this is a string with at least one character.

details.description: Optional detailed description of the domain. Describe the domain's purpose, scope, and the types of functionality it encompasses. Helps readers understand the domain's boundaries.

realized.description: Optional flag indicating whether this domain is realized (implemented) or abstract. Default is false (not realized). Set to true if this domain contains concrete implementations rather than abstract specifications.

uml_comment.description: Optional UML comment for diagram annotations. This text appears as a note attached to the domain package in generated UML diagrams.
